review_title: Elementary Nonsense in Varying Degrees of Lunacy
After this film, my Fiancée looked at me and said "I didn't know a film could be so bad".
review_detailed_main:
I'll begin at the end; upon leaving the screening of this movie, I was reduced to one word, "Wow". I was genuinely staggered by the fact that such a floating turd of a film had somehow managed to hustle itself a cinematic release.

Until December 27th, 2018 I was of the opinion that I would watch Jon C Reilly in absolutely anything, "Holmes & Watson" proved me wrong.

Steve Coogan, Rob Brydon, Rebecca Hall, Pam Ferris, Ralph Feinnes, Hugh Laurie and Kelly Macdonald will all have to wake up every day for the rest of their lives, knowing that they had a hand on this film, the stink of which must cling to them like metaphorical sh#t to a blanket.

Sir Arthur Conan Doyle received a writing credit for this film. I just checked; he doesn't have any living descendants who could try to have this black mark expunged from his career.

The only reason I rated this move a 1 out of 10 stars is because negative numbers aren't available. I didn't crack a smile let alone laugh. Will Farrell's flicks just seem to get worse and worse as he plays the same character over and over again. John C. Reilly is a very good actor who for some reason keeps teaming up with the over-the-hill Farrell. The result was this unfunny, irritating mess. The only good thing I can say about this movie was it was only around an hour and a half. Mind you, an hour and a half too long but still, a short movie by today's standards. This is only the second review I've felt compelled to write but this movie was so bad I just had to tell someone. If I had it to do over again I'd watch "Planes, Trains, and Automobiles" for maybe the tenth time. Somewhere along the way great comedies, or even adequate comedies, have become a thing of the past.
Huge fan of both actors , i really loved their type of humor but this movie is just pure garbage, its embarrassing awkward and stupid
How on earth did this get made?! Its so bad it's just mind boggling - they must have paid Ralph Fiennes a mountain of cash to ruin his legacy...

This is, without doubt, the worst movie I have ever seen. How the heck can a film with Will Ferrell and John C Reilly be so joyless? It would be funny if you're 6 years old, but I don't suppose it's aimed at 6 year olds when it has a brilliant Kelly Macdonald's character as a sex worker.

Everyone involved should be thoroughly ashamed of themselves., and that includes the wonderful Pam Ferris.

review_title: This just came on TV and found it unwatchable

It's just him being himself but it didn't work here. And John C. Reilly who's a much better performer couldn't hold this thing together and you can genuinely see him trying to make the effort.

It would have been funnier if the story was about a man trying to play Sherlock Holmes in a play and failing miserably at it.

I'm sure the outtake reel is full them endlessly breaking character having more fun making this movie than anyone ever will watching it.
Even in the sourest of moods one may fine solace in this movies' comedy. You will laugh dammit!!! I would love to see a sequel to this. The bit with the Queen at Holmes place. Omg. I just laughed.

review_title: Not the greatest, not the worst!

It was moderately entertaining. So what if the acting was not all that great and the editing was a bit off, who really cares? It is about entertainment and this entertained me for an afternoon. Fun to see some well known actors pop up now and then, like Steve Coogan, he always makes me laugh. At the end of the day it isn't something I would watch again and I will forget all about it soon enough but it wasn't the big pile of poo some people were going on about it. Bunch of whingers, go and watch something else. Just because you don't like it you don't have to score it '1' for goodness sake. Idiots.

I'm not a huge fan of Ferrell - he can be terribly self-indulgent (and there are elements of that here), but when he gets it right he is very funny. Reilly is always good value. They make a great team in this, with some real belly laughs resulting (the accents especially made me guffaw - pronunciations reminiscent of the Gendarme in Brit sitcom 'Allo 'Allo!) The plot is satisfying with a couple of neat surprises and a really good ending/coda. It's exceedingly silly, knockabout fun. Put your brain in neutral and enjoy.
Most awful movie I've seen these actors do. Idk how anyone thought it was a good idea to release this.. no respect.

review_title: Not nearly as bad as people are saying

review_title: One of the worst movies ever made

It's worse than just bad acting, plot, directing, etc. It seems to be an attempt by writers to find a way to trash the president and the country and somehow make a movie about it. I paid $12.50 for a ticket and almost want to take the producers to small claims court to get it back, it was that bad! Not only should you not go to theaters to see this, you should avoid it at all costs even when you can see it on netflix for free.

Think of the worst thing you have ever smelled. Now multiply it by a trillion. This movie stinks worse than that. I'm tired of Hollywood thinking anyone wants to be subjected to politics when they pay their hard earned money to be entertained. This movie should come with a warning: Not Funny, Not Satirical, Boring, Political. They should pay people to watch it, not the other way aro.
Hardly anyone in the theater laughed at this. Boring.

review_title: Jumpin' Jesus and Mary in a sidecar! What a fecal pile this movie was!
review_detailed_main:
My wife and I watched it yesterday to a packed house. A house packed with vacant space. This should have warned me that the next 90 minutes was going to be minutes I am going to lose forever and have nothing valid happen other than reclining in the comfy theater chair and know my wife is by my side suffering with me.

The best thing about this movie was the questions it brought up such as "How did this script ever get a green light for production???" "What horrible secrets do the producers know about Will Ferrel and John C. Reilly for them to sign onto this movie???" and "Did we really just blow $16 to recline comfortably and absolutely no other reason?" These questions and many others are what actually made this movie entertaining to us.

I laughed exactly one time at a 3 second portion of the autopsy scene. So 0.000555% of the movie was 10 stars, so it has that going for it.

All in all, go in drunk, bring some beers with you, expect absolutely nothing funny (except that 0.000555%) and look at your phones for the entirety of the movie and you have yourself a winner!

Honestly I don't get the appeal of Will Farrell. He's just not funny. And while John C Reilly can do decently if given the proper direction, he's wasted here in this movie.

This is supposed to be a spoof about Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson. In it Holmes is a complete narcissist who believes himself to be a great detective because the press says he is. And Watson is reduced to singing Holmes' praises and being abused by him at all turns.

If you've seen their back and forth in other movies you won't be surprised here. If you haven't and this is your first time, then prepare to be disappointed because it's just not funny.

To put this into perspective the producers knew this was a dog and wanted to sell it to Netflix because they tend to jump at any chance to get original movies. Netflix turned them down because they felt it was too stupid. Netflix turned them down. This is the same company that produced and showed Adam Sandler's "The Ridiculous 6". A movie so bad that I don't know anybody who actually likes it. When the low bar for what you'll take and what you won't is an Adam Sandler movie then you know it's time to pack it in.

review_title: A silly take on the classic tale. What did you expect?
review_detailed_main:
When I saw the trailer for this I laughed a few times, which was enough to raise my interest in seeing the movie. Then I read that all the reviews said it was awful and I was surprised because Farrell and Reilly are usually good together.

After seeing it I can say that it's not nearly as terrible as people say. I don't get what all the hate was about. Sure, there are some pretty dumb moments, but I was mostly laughing throughout. It's basically a silly/slapstick comedy, which is clear from the trailer.

Also, I didn't see any of the "sloppy editing" and "shots out of focus" that's listed in the trivia, and I don't get why people would have walked out en masse as claimed. I've seen far worse.

All in all I don't know what people were expecting, but if you liked Farrell and Reilly together previously then you'll likely enjoy this as well. It's not quite as good as Step Brothers, but I definitely did not regret watching it.

review_title: It's intermittently amusing but ultimately average.
review_detailed_main: There are some amusing moments but, on the whole, 'Holmes & Watson (2018)' is just totally average. It's not as bad as most reviews purport it to be but it's nowhere near as funny or generally accomplished as you'd expect from a reuniting of Ferrell and Reilly - who are both often hilarious in real life and made the excellent 'Step-brothers (2010)' together. The film is not as much a parody as it is a cash-in on the relatively recently lapsed copyright associated with the Sherlock Holmes character and his earliest of stories, making for a strange missed opportunity when it comes to where the laughs are (supposedly) coming from. The piece also leaves something to be desired in terms of its story - in particular, the central 'mystery' - and its character arcs, the latter of which are mostly rushed through in a bizarre (and lazy) musical moment towards the finale. I didn't necessarily dislike the experience while it was occurring, but it's almost instantly forgettable and the handful of successful jokes don't exactly make you howl, either. 5/10

review_title: A masterpiece of silly, fun humour!
review_detailed_main:
You will not like this movie if you are: 1. a Trump supporter that gets butthurt over a small 2 minute throw-away joke. 2. A gun-toting American "patriot" who gets butthurt over some light-hearted jokes about America 3. A humourless (and might I say, obsolete) movie reviewer, who never gives comedies good reviews anyway (unless they are "indie" that is). 4. An obsessive fan of BBC's Sherlock who holds that version as sacred and sees anything having fun with the Holmes story as sacrilege. 5. Someone who just doesn't know how to have fun.

You will like this film if you are: 1. Someone who knows how to have fun. 2. Someone who understands and enjoys this kind of light-hearted, silly humour. 3. Probably not American, and especially not a Trump supporter. 4. A fan of previous Ferrell movies like Step Brothers etc. 5. Just a stand-up, awesome person.

I'm guessing some won't even read this, but for those who do, even though they feel offended by the movie and my rating: I get it. I felt similar when I saw the depiction of Bruce Lee in Once upon a time in America. And I'm not talking about how he fought or how he looked, but the way he was depicted. Arrogant is one thing (he may or may not have been like this or close to that), but the fact he was made to look as though he wasn't smart (to put it mildly).

Having said all that, there is more to OuaTiH, something that can hardly be applied here. Because you have quite the silly and really quite questionable depiction of two beloved figures. Not because the filmmakers don't like them, but because they wanted to do something different.

And boy is this different. Predictable still and quite the rude humor and a bit dull for some for sure. It's tough to see merits, like the amount of good actors involved in this in smaller roles. You may or may not care, but if you don't adjust yourself into what is going down with this movie, you will have the worst time ....

review_title: I walked out of the theater.
review_detailed_main: This is the first time in my life I ever walked out of a theater. This movie is total garbage. Both Will Farrell and John C. Reilly (both of whom I've liked in other films) humiliate themselves in this. I didn't chuckle once! All I was did was cringe at the dumb jokes and idiotic gags. The story was one of the lamest things I've ever seen and the acting just awful. This movie is simply unwatchable. Please do everything you can to avoid it!

review_title: Absolutely as bad as they say.
review_detailed_main: I went to see this without having seen a single review beforehand and expecting it to be somewhere in the ballpark of Stepbrothers humour-wise. Walked out after less than an hour. My girlfriend who will never walk out of a terrible film pretty much grabbed her coat as soon as I mentioned leaving. It is not funny in the slightest and painfully predictable. I normally get frustrated reading 1 star IMBD reviews because in reality there are very few 1 star movies, but this one 100 percent is. The people giving this movie 10 star reviews must be living on a different planet. A trip to the dentist or a child's funeral would be a better option than going to see this film. Everyone involved in making this movie should be ashamed. And shot.

Sherlock Holmes (Will Ferrell) and Dr. Watson (John C. Reilly) are best friends since childhood. Holmes was bullied by all the rich kids and Watson was the janitor's son. Professor James Moriarty (Ralph Fiennes) is on trial but Holmes has a revelation. Queen Victoria is under threat. The boys meet American doctor Grace Hart (Rebecca Hall) and her simpleton travel companion Millicent (Lauren Lapkus). Mrs. Martha Hudson (Kelly Macdonald) is the boys' very inappropriate housekeeper.

This is aggressively unfunny. There is a central problem. Holmes is both super smart and super moronic. In Pink Panther, Clouseau stumbles his way into solving his cases. That's not the case here. Holmes is actually smart and solves his cases deductively. He's also a complete idiot and those two clash at the same time in the same scenes. It's hella confusing. It never comes to solving that central problem. As for the comedy, there is only one funny line in the whole movie. " I'm actually more taken with the mystery. It's a whodunnit and not necessarily a solvable one. It is however a definable one with specific suspects. So the mystery is better than the comedy and that's not a good thing for this movie. These two are really struggling in this one.

I have never rated a movie on IMDB before, but this movie was so god-awfully terrible that I felt compelled to. I cannot emphasize how truly bad this movie was. How such a promising cast could deliver such garbage heaps of cringe-worthy attempts at humor is beyond me. If I could give it negative stars, I would.
Just not good writing. Both are brilliant comedians but the accents were horrible and the jokes were lame
Thought would relax on boxing Day & have a good laugh. Not the case, not funny at all. Left cinema after 30 mins. Absolutely Rubbish.

review_title: Entertaining if you have an IQ of 80

review_detailed_main: Definitely not a 1. I had seen the poor reviews but went cause I am a fan of Will Ferrell. Setting my expectations low I was actually pleasantly suprised. Its a fresh take on Sherlock holmes with plenty of hilarious moments. I think it definitely deserves a higher rating.
Hard to believe a movie about Sherlock Holmes could be this bad. Simply not worth seeing. The occasional funny moments weren't worth the price of admission.
